title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
Hello, 
Looking for some help here , This macbook came  in dead , customer stated that it was charging and left connected overnight then the next day the computer was not coming on , I opened it and found U4910 and U4920 were both fried to ashes, When i ran a quick Diode mode only in that area I found that power rail PP1V8_MESA was fully shorted to ground , I then removed and replaced U4910 And U4920 and the short was gone , but the computer is still not  booting . I  measured PPBUS_G3H in diode mode and I got a value of 0.388 and in   voltage mode I am getting 12.25 V but my amp meter is still reading 5V I have not changed The USB Controller chips U3100 OR U3200
Please advice that would be highly appreciated.

Thank you very much

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
Is the machine recognized in DFU mode?
Did you test the board alone on the desk?
At leats try disconnecting audio flex.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message: I have not done any DFU mode test yet , I did test the Board alone by removing it completely out . When I connect it to my DC POWER SUPPLY , its consuming 0.47 milliamps. Let me know if there s any other test to run please.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
Pretty sure you can't measure 0.47 milamps (470 microamps).

470 miliA means there is significant consumption; you probably get voltage on various big coils.

Do you think about Volts, or Ampers.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
How can you explain one meter shows 470 mA and the other only 8 mA?
Use the normal one and forget that blue bulshit.

Check AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages; the small coils around U7800.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
Yes, I put the Blue stuff on a side , 
I checked the voltages of The small coils around U7800,

The AWAKE Voltages  

PPVDDCPU_AWAKE = 0.589
PPVDDCPUSRAM_AWAKE =0.00
All the  SLPS2R voltages = 0.000
Does that mean U7800 is dead?

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
Compare their diode mode readings with good board.

"All the  SLPS2R voltages = 0.000"
Even 0V8?
That is an LDO.
Check R7900 and diode mode to ground on both sides.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
Yes even 0V8  =0.000

for R7900 One side PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VINRTC_R = 0.493 
and the other side PP3V3_G3H_RTC = 0.340 in diode mode to  ground.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
So R7900 is burnt, as you don't get same reading.
I expected you to check its ohm value first...

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message: The reading of R7900 in Ohm is  20

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message: So you conclude that R7900 is burnt as values are not the same on both sides.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message: Any Suggestions?

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
Didn't change it yet?
Must be 0 ohm (short).

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message: I am sorry i am a bit confused, so R7900  Should read 0 ohm in order to be good ?  My new question is I don't have an exact donor board here , Do you have any suggestions where else can i find another resistor with the same capacity ? (R7900)

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
The resistors have resistance; the capacitance is unwanted for any resistor.
The capacitance is the basic property of the capacitors.

0 ohm resistor can be replaced by a tiny cable; 0.03-0.1 mm is good enough.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message: Ok,  I don't have a donor Board here of the same macbook , where can i get a 0 ohm resistor to replace that one ?

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message: Great.  I will run a Jumper then. Will keep you in the loop.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
So 0.467 was in fact voltage, not diode mode reading.
Please, post end "V" to specify voltage reading.

Looks like you don't get PPBUS_G3H then.
Or you have a broken trace; check continuity from R6900...

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
Yes will do it from now on , it was 0.467V, See i am observing something very funny with this macbook, if i put it down for a day without connecting the USB amp meter then the next day i go back to it all diode mode reading of PPBUS_G3H is 0.388 And PPBUS_G3H is 12.18 V but the usb meter is still stuck on 5.22V 0.01 amp and 0watts 

As soon as I unplug and replug the USB amp meter PPBUS_G3H voltages would drop to 0.406V and all the other power rails would be giving very low diode mode reading as well as PPBUS_G3H Let me check the continuity  from R6900

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message: R6900 Does have continuity.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
Yeah, but you didn't specify missing PPBUS_G3H before.

U7000 can generate PPBUS_G3H with just 5V input.
Just check if you always get 5V at R7020.

Check them when missing PPBUS_G3H too.

You can try flashing TBT ROM now (U2890).

Maybe your CD3217 chips are not good, or not properly soldered.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987

I've expected to get these readings on charger alone, without battery connected.

"2- AUX_DET = 1.26V"
Be sure R7020 is not damaged.
Else, AUX_DET should be 2.5V aprox, with 10V at R7020.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
The readings I have sent was without battery connected , as I pulled the board out of the top case.

R7020 is intact i zoomed it under the scope with very clear view no physical damage, but I can replace it by a new one if you suggest me to , which side of R7020 I should measure to get the 10V ? is PPDCIN_G3H or PPDCIN_G3H_ CHGR?  also  AUX_DET   is on low voltage should i trace components on that line to see if anyone is slighly damaged which could cause the low voltage? 

Please advice thank you very much , I got this laptop for a while and customer is now driving me crazy.

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
With charger alone, you can't get 10V at R7020!
Its voltage comes from USB-C input, which can be 5V, or 20V.
As I already explained, if you really get 10V at R7020 (same as U7000 P_IN), then AUX_DET (U7000) MUST be 2.5V aprox.
Some of the readings posted before, must be wrong.

You can get 10V at R7020 only from system side (F7000), through Q7030/40; if battery has 10V then.
ONLY if Q7040 is bad, or incorrect controlleed by U7000.
And I repeat, you can't get 1.26V at AUX_DET with 10V at R7020.

No need to change R7020 if measure 0 ohm...

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
No need to remove R7020.
Just check if you get 0 ohm over it; in other words, 2 ohm between C7023 pins.
Also check if you get 0 ohm between R7015 and C7029.
If all these checkings good, then is impossible to have:
"1- P_IN = 10.41V
2- AUX_DET = 1.26V"

title: Macbook A2289  820-01987
message:
Communication bus between T2 and CD3217 chips seems to be good.

If CD3217 chips are really good, you may have a broken trace somewhere, or even internal damage on T2.
Can also be a simple bad resistor, not easy to find.

If reflashing U2890, nor DFU help, I don't see what else to do.

About UPC_XA_UART_TX, allow 10-15s after power is removed, before checking on diode mode.
There can't be short, if you get 3.3V.
